name: Tickle Pink Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a very nice room with a great view. They delivered a bottle of champagne to our room as a welcome gesture when we arrived. They also serve a better than average continental breakfast. Wine and cheese served daily from 4:30-6:30pm. Also good.
reviews.title: First stay in Carmel

likes.disliked: — Did not feel we received the value for our money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They claim that they searched around the world for the most comfortable bedding. They met this claim. I just wish they had applied the same principle to their bath towels. They were cheap and felt so on the skin.
reviews.title: A View but not much else...

reviews.text: I feel the place is a bit pricey based upon comparables. The staff is nice but I got the feeling that "it was just a job" for them.
reviews.title: Relies on the view
what a wonderful discovery
reviews.text: Overall we had a nice time but we would look at other options prior to visiting again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The View from our balcony was nice but the hotel itself is outdated. Hello?! You pay a lot of money for that lopsided motel bed. Come one where is the pillowtop mattress and feather pillows??? And the carpet is a dirty peach color yuck. I left a piece of jewelry in the bathroom and when we went back to get it ...gone...when we went to ask the front desk staff if anyone had turned it in they made me feel so stupid for being forgetful and leaving my ring behind. They became even more nasty when I told them we would have to file a police report for insurance purposes. I'm sure the staff member who has my ring is long gone in Mexico by now...
reviews.title: Treat yourself to a stay at The Pink

reviews.text: We stayed a night at this inn en route from Yosemite to Los Angeles. I would have to say that our opinion is coloured by the fog and chill that enveloped it, and made the view and the terrace irrelevant. The room was nice if overstuffed, the bed was pretty comfortable, the staff pleasant enough.
reviews.title: Ruined by breakfast
The room is worth the trip
reviews.text: But the 'breakfast' was totally unacceptable for a hotel of this size and price. I cannot believe that we did not get fresh orange juice, that the oatmeal was a packet of presweetened junk served with some luke warm water, the coffee stewed. Just appalling. Plus the serving staff spoke so little English we might as well have been in Albania.
My advice is find a diner in town, or eat at the next door Hyatt.
reviews.title: We Were Disappointed

reviews.text: I really don't think this place is value for money, but maybe if the sun had shone....who knows?
reviews.title: Just as good the second time around

reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our 10th anniversarry with our first trip to San Franscisco Bay area. After 4 activity packed days of Cable Cars, Redwoods, Napa, Alcatraz, 17 mile drive, etc, I purposely put the Tickle Pink at the end of our journey. Am I ever glad I did.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed one night at The Tickle Pink during a stopover in Carmel on our California trip (from San Francisco to Los Angeles - all down the Pacific Coast Highway -- DO IT!!!). The accomodations certainly were large enough; bed was very comfortable. Furniture was kind of old fashioned (not my taste, but I guess some people like it). Definitely needed updating. The breakfast buffet was not bad. Better than I expected after reading some other reviewers comments on it. THE VIEW alone IS WORTH staying here. I must say, the view is breathtaking. I've attached a couple of photos but they do not it any justice. You can also have the view from the breakfast terrace, in case you don't want to spend the money on a ocean view room. One definite downside is that this place is too far away from Carmel by the Sea (7 miles I think), so if you want to walk out of your hotel to go strolling in the charming little town of Carmel, you can't do it without having to get in your car and drive there.
reviews.title: Tickled pink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spectacular ocean views, clean rooms, luxurious bedding, nice wine and cheese reception in the afternoon, warm cookies, snuggly robes and fresh baked goodies in the morning with great coffee! The inn was very accomodating bringing us champagne and chocolate for our anniversary. The only draw back is the noise from the road below. It quites down in the evening though. I would request a suite furthest away from the guest reception area for more peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Tickled Pink by the Inn
Suite #6 at Tickle Pink
reviews.text: I can actually say that it was as advertised. When I called to book the Suite, the woman I spoke with told me that there would be a roof line view of the suites below (see picts) from the balcony but I wouldn’t be able to see it from inside the room or master bedroom. It was still an awesome view. If you can, book Suites 30 – 36. That would solve that problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wine and cheese tasting at the Tickle Pink was wonderful. We did walk down to the Hyatt for dinner since there is no onsite restaurant. It was just a short walk. The dinner was really good. Sitting out on the patio watching the sun go down during dinner was awesome, but a little chilly towards the end.
reviews.title: tickle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like so many other people we are planning (and saving) for our next trip to Tickle Pink. I think if we had booked the lower suites our stay would have been practically perfect. We took our 19 year old daughter and she had to sleep on a roll away so that kind of spoiled it for her. All things considered it was a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Perfect Interlude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have being going to Carmel on family vacations since about the age of 8 so I have developed a great affinity for the area. I have stayed at the Tickle Pink Inn on a couple of different occasions and simply loved it. It has amazing views of the ocean and it is just a great place to get away and relax.
reviews.title: beautiful & quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tickle Pink Inn during the last leg of our honeymoon. We enjoyed the accomadations and loved the late afternoon wine and cheese welcome. We were greeted with warm chocolate chip cookies upon check-in and we continued our celebrating with a complimentary bottle of champagne. The view was beautiful, however, we were surprised to learn that between the Inn and the ocean was a very busy and loud highway. The noise from the highway overpowered any sounds from the ocean and was less than desireable in viewing the cliffs of Carmel.
reviews.title: Beware of the highway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are beautiful places to stay in Carmel and if you are hoping to stay somewhere romantic with the sounds and vies of the ocean outside your window, and a working fireplace with breakfast brought to your room, stay at the Spindrift Inn in Monteray.
reviews.title: Everything we hoped it would be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This beautiful spot on a beautiful weekend was everything we had hoped it would be. Perfect location, wonderful service and well maintained property. Nice beds, linens and immaculate bathroom. The weather was perfect too.
reviews.title: All Around Perfect Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had thought the champagne and truffles offered to us were a special gift for my husband's birthday but apparently, it's offered to all guests. Nice touch! The wine and cheese reception and morning continental breakfast were nicely done.
reviews.title: Completely tickled!

likes.liked: — It was very romantic and the staff was awesome
likes.disliked: — i didn't get to stay long enough

description: A Carmel oceanfront hotel dramatically situated above the rocky coastline that stands at the gateway to world-famous Big Sur. Let yourself be pampered with every amenity…from cozy European bedding and private decks with sweeping views to homemade breakfast pastries and an evening wine & cheese reception with soothing classical music.
